articles.title: "CBS Evening News" headlines for Monday, November 19, 2018
articles.description: Here's a look at the top stories making headlines on the "CBS Evening News" with Jeff Glor.

articles.author: Jericka Duncan
articles.title: Young athletes abandon football as concussions rock high school teams
articles.description: Timmy Ditka decided to leave the sport after a serious injury sidelined him at a young age
articles.content: WEXFORD, Pa. — For many Americans, this is traditionally a big week for high school football. But this season, two players have died of injuries sustained on the field. With a growing concern about concussions, more players are deciding the sideline themselve… [+3272 chars]

articles.author: Meg Oliver
articles.title: Frantic search underway for Camp Fire victims' remains before rain washes away DNA
articles.description: Search teams are combing through twisted metal, trying to find mattresses or bathtubs where people might have taken cover
articles.content: PARADISE, Calif. — Rain is expected on Wednesday in Northern California, bringing relief but also the potential for mudslides. That could complicate the search for remains of victims of the Camp Fire, which claimed at least 77 lives. "It's heavily ash and soo… [+1954 chars]

articles.author: CBS/AP
articles.title: Feds arrest rapper Tekashi 6ix9ine on rackeetering, firearms charges
articles.description: Prosecutors allege he participated in the July shooting of a bystander in Brooklyn and the gunpoint robbery of his gang's rivals in the spring
articles.content: NEW YORK — The rapper known as Tekashi 6ix9ine was in federal custody Monday awaiting a Manhattan court appearance on racketeering charges alleging he participated in the July shooting of a bystander in Brooklyn and the gunpoint robbery of his gang's rivals l… [+2469 chars]

articles.author: Dean Reynolds
articles.title: Witnesses describe chaotic aftermath of Chicago hospital shooting
articles.description: As police swarmed the area, nurses and doctors were seen with their hands raised coming out
articles.content: CHICAGO — Witnesses are describing the chaotic scene as a gunman opened fire at a hospital in Chicago's South Side. The shots started around 3:20 p.m. local time at Mercy Hospital & Medical Center. "It was extreme and it was very loud and it was close," o… [+676 chars]

articles.title: Woman describes scene of Chicago hospital shooting
articles.description: A witness tells CBS Chicago she heard "code silver" and "code blue" alerts inside Mercy Hospital where she hid during a shooting.

articles.author: Jason Silverstein
articles.title: House headwear ban could end as Muslim women join Congress
articles.description: A House rule from 1837 says every member must "remain uncovered during the sessions of the House"
articles.content: The first two Muslim women elected to Congress will soon be coming to Capitol Hill. And with them could come an end to a 181-year ban on headwear on the House floor. House Democrats are calling for the chamber to change its rules about headwear to allow membe… [+1907 chars]

articles.title: "Some of the training kicks in": Medical student reacts to shooting at Chicago hospital
articles.description: CBS Chicago spoke with a medical student who witnessed a shooting Monday afternoon at the Mercy Hospital and Medical Center on Chicago's South Side. He said training he's had for dangerous situations kicked in during this incident.

articles.title: "I heard shots fired": Witness describes scene at Chicago hospital
articles.description: CBS Chicago spoke with a man who witnessed a shooting outside Mercy Hospital and Medical Center, on Chicago's South Side. The man said the suspect was wearing all black clothing and was carrying a handgun. He says he saw at least two people shot.

articles.author: Danielle Garrand
articles.title: People in Finland are trolling Trump for saying the country rakes its forests
articles.description: The people of Finland are "raking" the benefits of President Trump's comments about spending "a lot of time raking"
articles.content: President Trump said Saturday that Finland's president claimed the country doesn't have many problems with forest fires because it spends "a lot of time on raking" -- and the Finnish people soon took to social media to troll his comments. Residents of the Eur… [+2590 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: After midterm elections, Democrats divided on Pelosi for speaker
articles.description: Most Americans want to see both sides work together, but few think that will happen
articles.content: By Jennifer De Pinto, Fred Backus and Anthony Salvanto Democrats nationwide are divided over whether current Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi should become the next speaker of the House. Forty-nine percent of Democrats would like to see Pelosi become speaker, but… [+1983 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Police respond to reports of shooting near Chicago hospital
articles.description: Police responded to reports of multiple victims from a shooting near a Chicago hospital Monday afternoon
articles.content: CHICAGO — Police responded to reports of multiple victims from a shooting near a Chicago hospital Monday afternoon, according to Chicago police. At least one possible offender is shot, police said. Chicago police spokesman Anthony Guglielmi tweeted Monday aft… [+440 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Gunman, 3 others dead after shooting several others at Chicago hospital
articles.description: A doctor, a pharmaceutical assistant and a police officer were killed in Monday's shooting, Chicago Mayor Rahm Emanuel said
articles.content: CHICAGO — Police said an officer and three others, including the gunman, are dead after a shooting at Chicago's Mercy Hospital. Chicago Mayor Rahm Emanuel said a doctor and a pharmaceutical assistant were the other victims. Anthony Guglielmi, a Chicago police… [+2663 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Police respond to reports of shooting near Chicago hospital
articles.description: Police responded to reports of multiple victims from a shooting near a Chicago hospital Monday afternoon

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: 27 hospitalized after falling ill with mysterious symptoms at Florida high school
articles.description: All of the victims were reported to be stable and improving after suffering various symptoms, but the cause of the mass sickness remains a mystery.
articles.content: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla. — More than two dozen students and an adult staff member were hospitalized Monday for possible exposure to an unknown substance at a high school in Fort Lauderdale, CBS Miami reports. "These students were having various states. Some were… [+1363 chars]

articles.title: Camel spotted on Pennsylvania highway during snowstorm
articles.description: Drivers did a double-take when they saw this camel walking along a Pennsylvania highway in a snowstorm, but its owner said there was a good reason.

articles.title: Possible treatment for peanut allergies
articles.description: A new treatment shows promise for treating children with severe peanut allergies. In a study, 2/3 of those who received gradually increasing doses of peanut powder for a year were able to eat several peanuts with no harmful reaction.

articles.author: Aimee Picchi
articles.title: Black Friday surprises: Price gotchas and sold-out inventory
articles.description: Consumers are primed to spend, but watch out for complications like policies on in-store pickup and free shipping
articles.content: Retailers are rolling out their Black Friday specials, but shoppers may be in for some surprises. Consumers are expected to spend an average of $803 each on Black Friday, an increase of almost 8 percent compared with a year earlier, according to RetailMeNot. … [+4755 chars]

articles.title: Child with special needs comforted by Winnie the Pooh at Disney World
articles.description: An 18-month-old boy with special needs was comforted by Winnie the Pooh at Disney World and the boy's mom said the moment melted her heart

articles.author: Kathy Kristof
articles.title: Bumped from a flight? It could land you a windfall
articles.description: Depending on the circumstances, the airline could owe you up to $1,350 -- and more if you baggage is also lost
articles.content: If you get bumped from your Thanksgiving flight, it could ruin your holiday but make your holiday season. Why? The airline could be forced to pay you a small fortune for the transgression, said Johnny Quach, chief product officer of AirHelp, a company that cl… [+5038 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Honey-filled pacifiers linked to cases of botulism
articles.description: Four infants in Texas were treated for botulism after being given a honey-containing pacifiers purchased in Mexico
articles.content: TEXAS — After four infants in Texas were treated for botulism, the Texas Department of State Health Services is warning parents and other adults not to give babies pacifiers containing honey. Health officials say the four infants who got sick had each been gi… [+1678 chars]

articles.title: Doctor and runner reunite after he saved her life during New York Marathon
articles.description: A runner had a heart attack at mile 16 of the New York Marathon, just as a doctor fatefully ran by. Now, the doctor and his patient are reunited for the first time since he saved her life.

articles.author: Kathryn Watson
articles.title: Giuliani says Trump's responses to Mueller will likely be turned over in next couple days
articles.description: The president said he has already "very easily" answered the questions from Mueller's team
articles.content: President Trump's written responses to questions from special counsel Robert Mueller are "likely to be turned over in the next couple of days," Trump attorney Rudy Giuliani told CBS News' Pat Milton in New York. Mr. Trump told reporters on Saturday he had "ve… [+1574 chars]

articles.title: Christopher Watts sentenced to life in prison for murders of his wife and children
articles.description: Christopher Watts was sentenced to life in prison after pleading guilty to murdering his pregnant wife Shanann and their two daughters in Colorado. CBS News' Mark Strassmann has the latest on the tragic story.

articles.author: Jason Silverstein
articles.title: Michelle Wolf calls WH Correspondents' Association "cowards" for choosing historian
articles.description: Next year's White House Correspondents Dinner will be no laughing matter
articles.content: Next year's White House Correspondents Dinner will be no laughing matter. The White House Correspondents' Association (WHCA) said Monday it won't be inviting a comedian to perform at its annual press dinner. The decision follows the uproar over Michelle Wolf'… [+2830 chars]

articles.title: Trump criticized for comments about retired admiral behind bin Laden raid
articles.description: President Trump faced fierce backlash Monday for comments about Adm. William McRaven, the retired Navy SEAL and special operations commander who oversaw the raid on Osama bin Laden's compound in 2011. Mr. Trump said McRaven should have killed the 9/11 masterm…

articles.title: Trump criticized for comments about retired admiral behind bin Laden raid
articles.description: President Trump faced fierce backlash Monday for comments about Adm. William McRaven, the retired Navy SEAL and special operations commander who oversaw the raid on Osama bin Laden's compound in 2011. Mr. Trump said McRaven should have killed the 9/11 masterm…

articles.author: Ed Leefeldt
articles.title: Fighting fires with "forest resilience" bonds
articles.description: Investors, environmentalists and insurers see a way to help states fund the mega-costly fight against mega-fires
articles.content: The rocky Yuba River meanders in a remote corner of California. It's here that insurers, environmentalists and venture capital firms are joining forces to create a "Forest Resilience Bond" aimed at solving a multibillion-dollar problem plaguing the wildfire-r… [+5109 chars]

articles.author: William Harwood
articles.title: NASA selects landing site for Mars 2020 rover
articles.description: NASA's Mars 2020 rover will land on an ancient lakebed near a broad delta in Jezero Crater to search for traces of life
articles.content: After years of analysis and debate, NASA announced Monday that the agency's next Mars rover will land near an ancient river delta where water once flowed into a 30-mile-wide, 1,600-foot-deep crater. Its mission will be to search for signs of ancient microbial… [+5184 chars]

articles.title: Radio host suing publisher of neo-Nazi site seeks bank records
articles.description: A Muslim-American radio host is seeking a court order to get bank records for a neo-Nazi website publisher after questioning his father under oath.
articles.content: A Muslim-American radio host's lawyers are seeking a court order to get bank records for a neo-Nazi website publisher after questioning his father under oath about money donated by the site's readers. Greg Anglin, the father of The Daily Stormer publisher And… [+4439 chars]

articles.author: CBS/AP
articles.title: Tech stocks drag down markets
articles.description: Apple, Facebook and Nvidia are leading stock markets down after an uncertain month
articles.content: Technology stocks are leading a slump on Wall Street, led by big drops in Apple and Facebook. The Dow briefly sank 500 points, or nearly 2 percent. Apple lost 3.7 percent in midday trading Monday and Facebook gave up 5.2 percent. Chipmaker Nvidia dropped anot… [+1688 chars]

articles.description: The feud between Casey Kasem's wife and children intensifies, amid questions over his death
articles.content: More than four years after radio legend Casey Kasem died, his wife Jean Kasem reveals to "48 Hours" for the first time her version of her husband's final days, levels allegations of murder in a lawsuit and discusses a heated family feud. "The Mysterious Death… [+3229 chars]

articles.title: New treatment "a breakthrough" for kids with peanut allergies, study finds - CBS News
articles.description: CBS News New treatment "a breakthrough" for kids with peanut allergies, study finds CBS News There could soon be a new treatment option to help millions of children who suffer from peanut allergies. The final results of a clinical trial are in, and show that …
articles.content: There could soon be a new treatment option to help millions of children who suffer from peanut allergies. The final results of a clinical trial are in, and show that it is possible for some people with a peanut allergy to protect themselves by carefully build… [+3781 chars]

articles.author: Kate Gibson
articles.title: Nearly 50 tons of beef recalled over E. coli risk
articles.description: JBS USA issues second big meat recall in as many months; last one linked to salmonella outbreak that sickened hundreds
articles.content: The weekend recall of nearly 100,000 pounds of ground beef possibly tainted with E. coli is the second large meat recall in as many months by JBS USA, a unit of the world's largest meat processor. Swift Beef Co. recalled 99.260 pounds of ground beef that many… [+1616 chars]

articles.author: Bo Erickson, Rebecca Kaplan and Ed O'Keefe
articles.title: At least 16 Democrats signal they would oppose Pelosi as speaker
articles.description: The tally could grow, possibly robbing Pelosi at second chance at the gavel
articles.content: A bloc of 16 House Democrats officially released a letter Monday declaring they will not support Nancy Pelosi's second bid for speaker. On January 3, when the new Congress convenes, at least 218 votes — half of the House of Representatives — will be needed in… [+3507 chars]

articles.author: Christopher Brito
articles.title: Trump rips Navy SEAL, says bin Laden should've been caught sooner
articles.description: "Wouldn't it have been nice if we got Osama bin Laden a lot sooner than that? Wouldn't it have been nice?" he said in a Fox News Sunday interview
articles.content: President Trump is under fire for criticizing the Navy SEAL who led the 2011 military operation that took out Osama bin Laden. In an interview with Fox News that aired Sunday, the commander-in-chief reproached retired four-star Adm. William McRaven for not ki… [+3083 chars]

articles.title: Nissan chairman Carlos Ghosn fired, arrested for alleged salary fraud
articles.description: Carlos Ghosn, the man credited with turning around Renault and Nissan, is accused of having under-reported his salary.

articles.title: CIA believes Saudi crown prince ordered Khashoggi's murder
articles.description: The CIA has concluded that Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman ordered the killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi last month. But President Trump seems to be sticking with his Saudi ally. Mustafa Akyol, a senior fellow at the Cato Institute's Center for Glo…

articles.title: PG&E faces criticism for keeping power on during California wildfire warning
articles.description: As the death toll from California's Camp Fire rises, Pacific Gas and Electric is facing criticism for keeping the power on during a "red flag" warning. CBS News' Meg Oliver joined CBSN from Paradise, California, where the search for victims is ongoing.

articles.title: How to stop robocalls? Telecom companies work to keep up
articles.description: More than 5 billion robocalls were made last month alone. A bipartisan group of lawmakers is proposing legislation to fine scammers, and the FCC is demanding telecommunications companies show their plans to meet new standards. CBS News correspondent Anna Wern…

articles.description: President Trump is facing new questions about how much he truly stands with the troops. CBS News White House correspondent Steven Portnoy has more in today's "Reporter's Notebook."

articles.title: Formula 3 racer Sophia Floersch fractures spine after airborne crash
articles.description: A 17-year-old German race car driver is undergoing surgery after fracturing her spine in a astonishing crash. Sophia Floersch went airborne Sunday when her car clipped another one during a Formula 3 race in Macau.

articles.title: How to prepare your turkey amid salmonella outbreak
articles.description: The CDC is warning about salmonella in turkey days before Thanksgiving. One-hundred-sixty-four people in 35 states have reported getting sick after eating turkey. Dr. Tara Narula joins "CBS This Morning" to discuss safety precautions.

articles.title: California fires take personal toll on firefighters
articles.description: More than 6,400 firefighters are battling California's two largest wildfires. Fire crews have faced five of the 10 most destructive fires in state history in just the past 13 months. DeMarco Morgan reports on the personal toll for those on the front lines.

articles.description: A Colorado man who pleaded guilty to killing his pregnant wife and two young daughters is being sentenced Monday. Christopher Watts confessed to the murders this month in a plea deal to avoid the death penalty. Mark Strassmann reports.
